intro: Microcharis microcharoides var. latestipulata, commonly known as the narrow-lobed microcharis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its unique inflorescence structure known as a spadix, surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a waxy surface, and its flowers are typically small and clustered. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
